Tasks needing human oversight:
Tasks involving ethical judgments, emotional understanding, and complex social decisions should always involve human oversight.
Also, critical responsibilities like healthcare, legal decisions, and safety-sensitive operations must remain under human control.
What makes a task unsuitable for automat: Has high risk or safety consequences
Country: general feeling about AI: In my context, people generally feel curious but cautious,  welcoming AI‚Äôs benefits while worrying about job security and ethical risks.
Balance of human vs AI:
Human control should guide all high-risk or value-based decisions, while AI handles routine, data-heavy tasks.
A clear system of human oversight, transparency, and final approval keeps the balance safe and effective.
One rule for AI:
I‚Äôd set a rule that AI must always be transparent about how it makes decisions.
And it should assist, not replace, human judgment in any important part of daily life.

Balance of human vs AI: Use AI as tool. Whoever is in charge of a task should be free to use AI so that he can complete it faster and with ease. This can boost productivity. However, if the task is not done as expected or contains errors, the person will be held responsible. When using AI, employees should keep in mind that he is using it as a tool and not relying completely on it. He should be aware that the task might need modification later on, which will be impossible if done solely with AI.
One rule for AI: Do not hallucinate or make up facts and ask for clarity if needed.
